intro: Lophanthus chinensis, commonly known as Chinese lophanthus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Lophanthus chinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
